#!/bin/bash

# Deploy script for web application

APP_NAME="myapp"
DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

# Pull latest code
cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
git pull origin main

# Install dependencies
npm ci --production

# Build application
npm run build

# Restart service
systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

# Check health
sleep 5
curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

echo "Deployment completed successfully"
 
#!/bin/bash

set -euo pipefail

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup database
pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Compress backup
gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed successfully"
 

    Error: Connection timeout
    Retrying... (attempt 1/3)
    Retrying... (attempt 2/3)
    Retrying... (attempt 3/3)
    Failed to connect to database
    Rolling back deployment...
    Rollback completed successfully
    Previous version restored: 2.4.9
  
    class DataService {
      constructor(apiUrl) {
        this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
        this.cache = new Map();
      }

      async fetchData(id) {
        if (this.cache.has(id)) {
          return this.cache.get(id);
        }

        const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
        const data = await response.json();
        this.cache.set(id, data);
        return data;
      }

      clearCache() {
        this.cache.clear();
      }
    }

    export default DataService;
  

    const processArray = (arr) => {
      return arr
        .filter(item => item.active)
        .map(item => ({
          ...item,
          timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
        }))
        .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
    };

    const debounce = (func, wait) => {
      let timeout;
      return function executedFunction(...args) {
        const later = () => {
          clearTimeout(timeout);
          func(...args);
        };
        clearTimeout(timeout);
        timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
      };
    };
  
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: my-service
spec:
  type: LoadBalancer
  selector:
    app: MyApp
  ports:
  - protocol: TCP
    port: 80
    targetPort: 9376
 
#!/bin/bash

set -euo pipefail

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup database
pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Compress backup
gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed successfully"
 

    {
      "users": [
        {
          "id": 1,
          "name": "John Doe",
          "email": "john@example.com",
          "roles": ["admin", "user"]
        },
        {
          "id": 2,
          "name": "Jane Smith",
          "email": "jane@example.com",
          "roles": ["user"]
        }
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "total": 2,
        "page": 1
      }
    }
  
class User < ApplicationRecord
  has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :comments

  validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
  validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

  before_save :normalize_email

  def full_name
    "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
  end

  private

  def normalize_email
    self.email = email.downcase.strip
  end
end
 
class DataService {
  constructor(apiUrl) {
    this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
    this.cache = new Map();
  }

  async fetchData(id) {
    if (this.cache.has(id)) {
      return this.cache.get(id);
    }

    const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
    const data = await response.json();
    this.cache.set(id, data);
    return data;
  }

  clearCache() {
    this.cache.clear();
  }
}

export default DataService;
 

    Error: Connection timeout
    Retrying... (attempt 1/3)
    Retrying... (attempt 2/3)
    Retrying... (attempt 3/3)
    Failed to connect to database
    Rolling back deployment...
    Rollback completed successfully
    Previous version restored: 2.4.9
  
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: web-app
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: web
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: web
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: app
        image: myapp:1.0
        env:
        - name: DATABASE_URL
          value: postgres://db:5432
 
module ApiClient
  class Base
    include HTTParty
    base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

    def initialize(token)
      @options = {
        headers: {
          'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
          'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
        }
      }
    end

    def get(endpoint)
      self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
    end

    def post(endpoint, data)
      self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
    end
  end
end
 

    class DataService {
      constructor(apiUrl) {
        this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
        this.cache = new Map();
      }

      async fetchData(id) {
        if (this.cache.has(id)) {
          return this.cache.get(id);
        }

        const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
        const data = await response.json();
        this.cache.set(id, data);
        return data;
      }

      clearCache() {
        this.cache.clear();
      }
    }

    export default DataService;
const processArray = (arr) => { return arr .filter(item => item.active) .map(item => ({ ...item, timestamp: new Date().toISOString() })) .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority); }; const debounce = (func, wait) => { let timeout; return function executedFunction(...args) { const later = () => { clearTimeout(timeout); func(...args); }; clearTimeout(timeout); timeout = setTimeout(later, wait); }; }; 

    class User < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
      has_many :comments

      validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
      validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

      before_save :normalize_email

      def full_name
        "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
      end

      private

      def normalize_email
        self.email = email.downcase.strip
      end
    end
  
require 'sinatra'
require 'json'

set :port, 4567
set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

before do
  content_type :json
end

get '/api/status' do
  { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
end

post '/api/users' do
  data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
  # Process user creation
  { success: true, user: data }.to_json
end

error 404 do
  { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
end
 

    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Service
    metadata:
      name: my-service
    spec:
      type: LoadBalancer
      selector:
        app: MyApp
      ports:
      - protocol: TCP
        port: 80
        targetPort: 9376
  
require 'sinatra'
require 'json'

set :port, 4567
set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

before do
  content_type :json
end

get '/api/status' do
  { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
end

post '/api/users' do
  data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
  # Process user creation
  { success: true, user: data }.to_json
end

error 404 do
  { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
end
 

    require 'sinatra'
    require 'json'

    set :port, 4567
    set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

    before do
      content_type :json
    end

    get '/api/status' do
      { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
    end

    post '/api/users' do
      data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
      # Process user creation
      { success: true, user: data }.to_json
    end

    error 404 do
      { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
    end
  
#!/bin/bash

for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
  echo "Processing node: $node"
  oc adm cordon "$node"
  oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
  echo "Node $node drained successfully"
done

echo "All nodes processed"
 
Deployment successful!
Application version: 2.5.0
Environment: production
Replicas: 5
Health check: PASSED
Database migration: COMPLETED
Cache warmed: YES
Deployment time: 2m 34s
 
#!/bin/bash

# Deploy script for web application

APP_NAME="myapp"
DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

# Pull latest code
cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
git pull origin main

# Install dependencies
npm ci --production

# Build application
npm run build

# Restart service
systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

# Check health
sleep 5
curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

echo "Deployment completed successfully"
 
    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Service
    metadata:
      name: my-service
    spec:
      type: LoadBalancer
      selector:
        app: MyApp
      ports:
      - protocol: TCP
        port: 80
        targetPort: 9376
  
#!/bin/bash

# Deploy script for web application

APP_NAME="myapp"
DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

# Pull latest code
cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
git pull origin main

# Install dependencies
npm ci --production

# Build application
npm run build

# Restart service
systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

# Check health
sleep 5
curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

echo "Deployment completed successfully"
 

    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Service
    metadata:
      name: my-service
    spec:
      type: LoadBalancer
      selector:
        app: MyApp
      ports:
      - protocol: TCP
        port: 80
        targetPort: 9376
  
NAME                           STATUS   ROLES    AGE   VERSION
worker-node-1                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
worker-node-2                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
worker-node-3                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-1                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-2                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-3                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
 

    module ApiClient
      class Base
        include HTTParty
        base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

        def initialize(token)
          @options = {
            headers: {
              'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
              'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
            }
          }
        end

        def get(endpoint)
          self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
        end

        def post(endpoint, data)
          self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
        end
      end
    end
  
{
  "name": "my-package",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A sample package",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "jest",
    "build": "webpack --mode production",
    "start": "node index.js"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "express": "^4.18.0",
    "dotenv": "^16.0.0"
  }
}
 
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: my-service
spec:
  type: LoadBalancer
  selector:
    app: MyApp
  ports:
  - protocol: TCP
    port: 80
    targetPort: 9376
 

    const processArray = (arr) => {
      return arr
        .filter(item => item.active)
        .map(item => ({
          ...item,
          timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
        }))
        .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
    };

    const debounce = (func, wait) => {
      let timeout;
      return function executedFunction(...args) {
        const later = () => {
          clearTimeout(timeout);
          func(...args);
        };
        clearTimeout(timeout);
        timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
      };
    };
  
    {
      "apiVersion": "v1",
      "kind": "Config",
      "clusters": [
        {
          "name": "my-cluster",
          "cluster": {
            "server": "https://api.example.com:6443",
            "certificate-authority": "/path/to/ca.crt"
          }
        }
      ],
      "users": [
        {
          "name": "admin",
          "user": {
            "token": "sample-token-here"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  

    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Service
    metadata:
      name: my-service
    spec:
      type: LoadBalancer
      selector:
        app: MyApp
      ports:
      - protocol: TCP
        port: 80
        targetPort: 9376
  

    module ApiClient
      class Base
        include HTTParty
        base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

        def initialize(token)
          @options = {
            headers: {
              'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
              'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
            }
          }
        end

        def get(endpoint)
          self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
        end

        def post(endpoint, data)
          self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
        end
      end
    end
  
const processArray = (arr) => {
  return arr
    .filter(item => item.active)
    .map(item => ({
      ...item,
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
    }))
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
};

const debounce = (func, wait) => {
  let timeout;
  return function executedFunction(...args) {
    const later = () => {
      clearTimeout(timeout);
      func(...args);
    };
    clearTimeout(timeout);
    timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
  };
};
 

    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Pod
    metadata:
      name: example-pod
      namespace: default
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx:latest
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
  
#!/bin/bash

for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
  echo "Processing node: $node"
  oc adm cordon "$node"
  oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
  echo "Node $node drained successfully"
done

echo "All nodes processed"
 

    {
      "apiVersion": "v1",
      "kind": "Config",
      "clusters": [
        {
          "name": "my-cluster",
          "cluster": {
            "server": "https://api.example.com:6443",
            "certificate-authority": "/path/to/ca.crt"
          }
        }
      ],
      "users": [
        {
          "name": "admin",
          "user": {
            "token": "sample-token-here"
          }
        }
      ]
    }

    class User < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
      has_many :comments

      validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
      validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

      before_save :normalize_email

      def full_name
        "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
      end

      private

      def normalize_email
        self.email = email.downcase.strip
      end
    end
  
    #!/bin/bash

    # Deploy script for web application

    APP_NAME="myapp"
    DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
    REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

    echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

    # Pull latest code
    cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
    git pull origin main

    # Install dependencies
    npm ci --production

    # Build application
    npm run build

    # Restart service
    systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

    # Check health
    sleep 5
    curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

    echo "Deployment completed successfully"
  

    class DataService {
      constructor(apiUrl) {
        this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
        this.cache = new Map();
      }

      async fetchData(id) {
        if (this.cache.has(id)) {
          return this.cache.get(id);
        }

        const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
        const data = await response.json();
        this.cache.set(id, data);
        return data;
      }

      clearCache() {
        this.cache.clear();
      }
    }

    export default DataService;
  

    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Pod
    metadata:
      name: example-pod
      namespace: default
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx:latest
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
  

    {
      "apiVersion": "v1",
      "kind": "Config",
      "clusters": [
        {
          "name": "my-cluster",
          "cluster": {
            "server": "https://api.example.com:6443",
            "certificate-authority": "/path/to/ca.crt"
          }
        }
      ],
      "users": [
        {
          "name": "admin",
          "user": {
            "token": "sample-token-here"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  
#!/bin/bash

set -euo pipefail

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup database
pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Compress backup
gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed successfully"
 
Deployment successful!
Application version: 2.5.0
Environment: production
Replicas: 5
Health check: PASSED
Database migration: COMPLETED
Cache warmed: YES
Deployment time: 2m 34s
 

    require 'sinatra'
    require 'json'

    set :port, 4567
    set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

    before do
      content_type :json
    end

    get '/api/status' do
      { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
    end

    post '/api/users' do
      data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
      # Process user creation
      { success: true, user: data }.to_json
    end

    error 404 do
      { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
    end
  
#!/bin/bash

for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
  echo "Processing node: $node"
  oc adm cordon "$node"
  oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
  echo "Node $node drained successfully"
done

    kind: Service
    metadata:
      name: my-service
    spec:
      type: LoadBalancer
      selector:
        app: MyApp
      ports:
      - protocol: TCP
        port: 80
        targetPort: 9376

#!/bin/bash

set -euo pipefail

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup database
pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Compress backup
gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed successfully"
 

    import express from 'express';
    import { createServer } from 'http';

    const app = express();
    const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

    app.use(express.json());

    app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
      res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
    });

    app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
      const { data } = req.body;
      // Process data
      res.json({ success: true, data });
    });

    createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
      console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
    });

Replicas: 5

#!/bin/bash

set -euo pipefail

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup database
pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Compress backup
gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed successfully"
 

    Deployment successful!
    Application version: 2.5.0
    Environment: production
    Replicas: 5
    Health check: PASSED
    Database migration: COMPLETED
    Cache warmed: YES
    Deployment time: 2m 34s
class DataService { constructor(apiUrl) { this.apiUrl = apiUrl; this.cache = new Map(); } async fetchData(id) { if (this.cache.has(id)) { return this.cache.get(id); } const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`); const data = await response.json(); this.cache.set(id, data); return data; } clearCache() { this.cache.clear(); } } export default DataService; 

    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Service
    metadata:
      name: my-service
    spec:
      type: LoadBalancer
      selector:
        app: MyApp
      ports:
      - protocol: TCP
        port: 80
        targetPort: 9376
  
const processArray = (arr) => {
  return arr
    .filter(item => item.active)
    .map(item => ({
      ...item,
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
    }))
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
};

const debounce = (func, wait) => {
  let timeout;
  return function executedFunction(...args) {
    const later = () => {
      clearTimeout(timeout);
      func(...args);
    };
    clearTimeout(timeout);
    timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
  };
};
 

    #!/bin/bash

    # Deploy script for web application

    APP_NAME="myapp"
    DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
    REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

    echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

    # Pull latest code
    cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
    git pull origin main

    # Install dependencies
    npm ci --production

    # Build application
    npm run build

    # Restart service
    systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

    # Check health
    sleep 5
    curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

    echo "Deployment completed successfully"

    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "John Doe",
      "email": "john@example.com",
      "roles": ["admin", "user"]
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Jane Smith",
      "email": "jane@example.com",
      "roles": ["user"]
    }
  ],
  "metadata": {
    "total": 2,
    "page": 1
  }
}

    const processArray = (arr) => {
      return arr
        .filter(item => item.active)
        .map(item => ({
          ...item,
          timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
        }))
        .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
    };

    const debounce = (func, wait) => {
      let timeout;
      return function executedFunction(...args) {
        const later = () => {
          clearTimeout(timeout);
          func(...args);
        };
        clearTimeout(timeout);
        timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
      };
    };
  

    class User < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
      has_many :comments

      validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
      validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

      before_save :normalize_email

      def full_name
        "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
      end

      private

      def normalize_email
        self.email = email.downcase.strip
      end
    end

    Application version: 2.5.0
    Environment: production
    Replicas: 5
    Health check: PASSED
    Database migration: COMPLETED
    Cache warmed: YES
    Deployment time: 2m 34s
  
module ApiClient
  class Base
    include HTTParty
    base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

    def initialize(token)
      @options = {
        headers: {
          'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
          'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
        }
      }
    end

    def get(endpoint)
      self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
    end

    def post(endpoint, data)
      self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
    end
  end
end
 

    class User < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
      has_many :comments

      validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
      validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

      before_save :normalize_email

      def full_name
        "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
      end

      private

      def normalize_email
        self.email = email.downcase.strip
      end
    end
  

    NAME                           STATUS   ROLES    AGE   VERSION
    worker-node-1                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
    worker-node-2                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
    worker-node-3                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
    control-plane-1                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
    control-plane-2                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
    control-plane-3                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
  
#!/bin/bash

set -euo pipefail

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup database
pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Compress backup
gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed successfully"
 
module ApiClient
  class Base
    include HTTParty
    base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

    def initialize(token)
      @options = {
        headers: {
          'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
          'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
        }
      }
    end

    def get(endpoint)
      self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
    end

    def post(endpoint, data)
      self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
    end
  end
end
 
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: example-pod
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - name: nginx
    image: nginx:latest
    ports:
    - containerPort: 80
 

    class DataService {
      constructor(apiUrl) {
        this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
        this.cache = new Map();
      }

      async fetchData(id) {
        if (this.cache.has(id)) {
          return this.cache.get(id);
        }

        const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
        const data = await response.json();
        this.cache.set(id, data);
        return data;
      }

      clearCache() {
        this.cache.clear();
      }
    }

    export default DataService;
  
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: web-app
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: web
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: web
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: app
        image: myapp:1.0
        env:
        - name: DATABASE_URL
          value: postgres://db:5432
 

    Deployment successful!
    Application version: 2.5.0
    Environment: production
    Replicas: 5
    Health check: PASSED
    Database migration: COMPLETED
    Cache warmed: YES
    Deployment time: 2m 34s
  
    Error: Connection timeout
    Retrying... (attempt 1/3)
    Retrying... (attempt 2/3)
    Retrying... (attempt 3/3)
    Failed to connect to database
    Rolling back deployment...
    Rollback completed successfully
    Previous version restored: 2.4.9
  

    #!/bin/bash

    set -euo pipefail

    BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
    TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

    echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

    # Create backup directory
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

    # Backup database
    pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Compress backup
    gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
    find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

    echo "Backup completed successfully"
  
import express from 'express';
import { createServer } from 'http';

const app = express();
const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

app.use(express.json());

app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
  res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
});

app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
  const { data } = req.body;
  // Process data
  res.json({ success: true, data });
});

createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
  console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
});
 

    module ApiClient
      class Base
        include HTTParty
        base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

        def initialize(token)
          @options = {
            headers: {
              'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
              'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
            }
          }
        end

        def get(endpoint)
          self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
        end

        def post(endpoint, data)
          self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
        end
      end
    end
  

    import express from 'express';
    import { createServer } from 'http';

    const app = express();
    const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

    app.use(express.json());

    app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
      res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
    });

    app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
      const { data } = req.body;
      // Process data
      res.json({ success: true, data });
    });

    createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
      console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
    });
  
#!/bin/bash

for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
  echo "Processing node: $node"
  oc adm cordon "$node"
  oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
  echo "Node $node drained successfully"
done

echo "All nodes processed"

      "users": [

          "id": 1,
          "name": "John Doe",
          "email": "john@example.com",
          "roles": ["admin", "user"]
        },
        {
          "id": 2,
          "name": "Jane Smith",
          "email": "jane@example.com",
          "roles": ["user"]
        }
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "total": 2,
        "page": 1
      }
    }

    #!/bin/bash

    set -euo pipefail

    BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
    TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

    echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

    # Create backup directory
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

    # Backup database
    pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Compress backup
    gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
    find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

    echo "Backup completed successfully"
  

    {
      "apiVersion": "v1",
      "kind": "Config",
      "clusters": [
        {
          "name": "my-cluster",
          "cluster": {
            "server": "https://api.example.com:6443",
            "certificate-authority": "/path/to/ca.crt"
          }
        }
      ],
      "users": [
        {
          "name": "admin",
          "user": {
            "token": "sample-token-here"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: web-app
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: web
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: web
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: app
        image: myapp:1.0
        env:
        - name: DATABASE_URL
          value: postgres://db:5432
 
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: web-app
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: web
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: web
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: app
        image: myapp:1.0
        env:
        - name: DATABASE_URL
          value: postgres://db:5432
 

    const processArray = (arr) => {
      return arr
        .filter(item => item.active)
        .map(item => ({
          ...item,
          timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
        }))
        .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
    };

    const debounce = (func, wait) => {
      let timeout;
      return function executedFunction(...args) {
        const later = () => {
          clearTimeout(timeout);
          func(...args);
        };
        clearTimeout(timeout);
        timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
      };
    };
  
Deployment successful!
Application version: 2.5.0
Environment: production
Replicas: 5
Health check: PASSED
Database migration: COMPLETED
Cache warmed: YES
Deployment time: 2m 34s
 
#!/bin/bash

set -euo pipefail

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup database
pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Compress backup
gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed successfully"
 
#!/bin/bash

set -euo pipefail

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup database
pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Compress backup
gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed successfully"
 
{
  "apiVersion": "v1",
  "kind": "Config",
  "clusters": [{
    "name": "my-cluster",
    "cluster": {
      "server": "https://api.example.com:6443",
      "certificate-authority": "/path/to/ca.crt"
    }
  }],
  "users": [{
    "name": "admin",
    "user": {
      "token": "sample-token-here"
    }
  }]
}
 
const processArray = (arr) => {
  return arr
    .filter(item => item.active)
    .map(item => ({
      ...item,
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
    }))
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
};

const debounce = (func, wait) => {
  let timeout;
  return function executedFunction(...args) {
    const later = () => {
      clearTimeout(timeout);
      func(...args);
    };
    clearTimeout(timeout);
    timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
  };
};
 
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: web-app
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: web
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: web
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: app
        image: myapp:1.0
        env:
        - name: DATABASE_URL
          value: postgres://db:5432

import express from 'express';
import { createServer } from 'http';

const app = express();
const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

app.use(express.json());

app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
  res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
});

app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
  const { data } = req.body;
  // Process data
  res.json({ success: true, data });
});

createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
  console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
});
 
import express from 'express';import { createServer } from 'http';

  res.json({ success: true, data });

    require 'sinatra'
    require 'json'

    set :port, 4567
    set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

    before do
      content_type :json
    end

    get '/api/status' do
      { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
    end

    post '/api/users' do
      data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
      # Process user creation
      { success: true, user: data }.to_json
    end

    error 404 do
      { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
    end

      name: web-app

      replicas: 3
      selector:
        matchLabels:
          app: web

            app: web
        spec:
          containers:

            - name: DATABASE_URL

    #!/bin/bash

    # Deploy script for web application

    APP_NAME="myapp"
    DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
    REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

    echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

    # Pull latest code
    cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
    git pull origin main

    # Install dependencies
    npm ci --production

    # Build application
    npm run build

    # Restart service
    systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

    # Check health
    sleep 5
    curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

    echo "Deployment completed successfully"

    worker-node-3                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
    control-plane-1                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
    control-plane-2                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
    control-plane-3                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2

class DataService { constructor(apiUrl) { this.apiUrl = apiUrl; this.cache = new Map(); } async fetchData(id) { if (this.cache.has(id)) { return this.cache.get(id); } const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`); const data = await response.json(); this.cache.set(id, data); return data; } clearCache() { this.cache.clear(); } } export default DataService;

import express from 'express'; import { createServer } from 'http'; const app = express(); const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000; app.use(express.json()); app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => { res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() }); }); app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => { const { data } = req.body; // Process data res.json({ success: true, data }); }); createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => { console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`); }); 

    class User < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
      has_many :comments

      validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
      validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

      before_save :normalize_email

      def full_name
        "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
      end

      private

      def normalize_email
        self.email = email.downcase.strip
      end
    end
  
#!/bin/bash

# Deploy script for web application

APP_NAME="myapp"
DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

# Pull latest code
cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
git pull origin main

# Install dependencies
npm ci --production

# Build application
npm run build

# Restart service
systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

# Check health
sleep 5
curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

echo "Deployment completed successfully"
 

    class DataService {
      constructor(apiUrl) {
        this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
        this.cache = new Map();
      }

      async fetchData(id) {
        if (this.cache.has(id)) {
          return this.cache.get(id);
        }

        const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
        const data = await response.json();
        this.cache.set(id, data);
        return data;
      }

      clearCache() {
        this.cache.clear();
      }
    }

    export default DataService;
  

    {
      "name": "my-package",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "description": "A sample package",
      "main": "index.js",
      "scripts": {
        "test": "jest",
        "build": "webpack --mode production",
        "start": "node index.js"
      },
      "dependencies": {
        "express": "^4.18.0",
        "dotenv": "^16.0.0"
      }
    }
  

    class DataService {
      constructor(apiUrl) {
        this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
        this.cache = new Map();
      }

      async fetchData(id) {
        if (this.cache.has(id)) {
          return this.cache.get(id);
        }

        const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
        const data = await response.json();
        this.cache.set(id, data);
        return data;
      }

      clearCache() {
        this.cache.clear();
      }
    }

    export default DataService;
  

    module ApiClient
      class Base
        include HTTParty
        base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

        def initialize(token)
          @options = {
            headers: {
              'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
              'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
            }
          }
        end

        def get(endpoint)
          self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
        end

        def post(endpoint, data)
          self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
        end
      end
    end
  
const processArray = (arr) => {
  return arr
    .filter(item => item.active)
    .map(item => ({
      ...item,
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
    }))
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
};

const debounce = (func, wait) => {
  let timeout;
  return function executedFunction(...args) {
    const later = () => {
      clearTimeout(timeout);
      func(...args);
    };
    clearTimeout(timeout);
    timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
  };
};
 
class DataService {
  constructor(apiUrl) {
    this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
    this.cache = new Map();
  }

  async fetchData(id) {
    if (this.cache.has(id)) {
      return this.cache.get(id);
    }

    const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
    const data = await response.json();
    this.cache.set(id, data);
    return data;
  }

  clearCache() {
    this.cache.clear();
  }
}

export default DataService;
 
#!/bin/bash

set -euo pipefail

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup database
pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Compress backup
gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed successfully"
 
    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Service
    metadata:
      name: my-service
    spec:
      type: LoadBalancer
      selector:
        app: MyApp
      ports:
      - protocol: TCP
        port: 80
        targetPort: 9376
  
    #!/bin/bash

    # Deploy script for web application

    APP_NAME="myapp"
    DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
    REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

    echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

    # Pull latest code
    cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
    git pull origin main

    # Install dependencies
    npm ci --production

    # Build application
    npm run build

    # Restart service
    systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

    # Check health
    sleep 5
    curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

    echo "Deployment completed successfully"

control-plane-1                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-2                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-3                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2

      name: web-app
    spec:
      replicas: 3

        matchLabels:

          containers:

    #!/bin/bash

    # Deploy script for web application

    APP_NAME="myapp"
    DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
    REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

    echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

    # Pull latest code
    cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
    git pull origin main

    # Install dependencies
    npm ci --production

    # Build application
    npm run build

    # Restart service
    systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

    # Check health
    sleep 5
    curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

    echo "Deployment completed successfully"
  

    apiVersion: apps/v1
    kind: Deployment
    metadata:
      name: web-app
    spec:
      replicas: 3
      selector:
        matchLabels:
          app: web
      template:
        metadata:
          labels:
            app: web
        spec:
          containers:
          - name: app
            image: myapp:1.0
            env:
            - name: DATABASE_URL
              value: postgres://db:5432
  
    #!/bin/bash

    for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
      echo "Processing node: $node"
      oc adm cordon "$node"
      oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
      echo "Node $node drained successfully"
    done

    echo "All nodes processed"
  

    class DataService {
      constructor(apiUrl) {
        this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
        this.cache = new Map();
      }

      async fetchData(id) {
        if (this.cache.has(id)) {
          return this.cache.get(id);
        }

        const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
        const data = await response.json();
        this.cache.set(id, data);
        return data;
      }

      clearCache() {
        this.cache.clear();
      }
    }

    export default DataService;
  
{
  "apiVersion": "v1",
  "kind": "Config",
  "clusters": [{
    "name": "my-cluster",
    "cluster": {
      "server": "https://api.example.com:6443",
      "certificate-authority": "/path/to/ca.crt"
    }
  }],
  "users": [{
    "name": "admin",
    "user": {
      "token": "sample-token-here"
    }
  }]
}
 

    class User < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
      has_many :comments

      validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
      validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

      before_save :normalize_email

      def full_name
        "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
      end

      private

      def normalize_email
        self.email = email.downcase.strip
      end
    end
  
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: my-service
spec:
  type: LoadBalancer
  selector:
    app: MyApp
  ports:
  - protocol: TCP
    port: 80
    targetPort: 9376
 
NAME                           STATUS   ROLES    AGE   VERSION
worker-node-1                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
worker-node-2                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
worker-node-3                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-1                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-2                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-3                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
 

    {
      "users": [
        {
          "id": 1,
          "name": "John Doe",
          "email": "john@example.com",
          "roles": ["admin", "user"]
        },
        {
          "id": 2,
          "name": "Jane Smith",
          "email": "jane@example.com",
          "roles": ["user"]
        }
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "total": 2,
        "page": 1
      }
    }
  
const processArray = (arr) => {
  return arr
    .filter(item => item.active)
    .map(item => ({
      ...item,
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
    }))
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
};

const debounce = (func, wait) => {
  let timeout;
  return function executedFunction(...args) {
    const later = () => {
      clearTimeout(timeout);
      func(...args);
    };
    clearTimeout(timeout);
    timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
  };
};
 

    #!/bin/bash

    # Deploy script for web application

    APP_NAME="myapp"
    DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
    REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

    echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

    # Pull latest code
    cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
    git pull origin main

    # Install dependencies
    npm ci --production

    # Build application
    npm run build

    # Restart service
    systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

    # Check health
    sleep 5
    curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

    echo "Deployment completed successfully"
  
{
  "users": [
    {
      "id": 1,

      "email": "john@example.com",

    },

      "id": 2,
      "name": "Jane Smith",
      "email": "jane@example.com",
      "roles": ["user"]
    }
  ],
  "metadata": {
    "total": 2,
    "page": 1
  }

    control-plane-1                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2

apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: my-service
spec:
  type: LoadBalancer
  selector:
    app: MyApp
  ports:
  - protocol: TCP
    port: 80

    class User < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
      has_many :comments

      validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
      validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

      before_save :normalize_email

      def full_name
        "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
      end

      private

      def normalize_email
        self.email = email.downcase.strip
      end
    end
  

    #!/bin/bash

    set -euo pipefail

    BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
    TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

    echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

    # Create backup directory
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

    # Backup database
    pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Compress backup
    gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
    find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

    echo "Backup completed successfully"
  
{
  "apiVersion": "v1",
  "kind": "Config",
  "clusters": [{
    "name": "my-cluster",
    "cluster": {
      "server": "https://api.example.com:6443",
      "certificate-authority": "/path/to/ca.crt"
    }
  }],
  "users": [{
    "name": "admin",
    "user": {
      "token": "sample-token-here"
    }
  }]
}
 #!/bin/bash set -euo pipefail BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups" TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S) echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP" # Create backup directory mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR" # Backup database pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql" # Compress backup gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql" # Remove old backups (keep last 7 days) find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete echo "Backup completed successfully" 

    #!/bin/bash

    for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
      echo "Processing node: $node"
      oc adm cordon "$node"
      oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
      echo "Node $node drained successfully"
    done

    echo "All nodes processed"

metadata:
  name: example-pod
  namespace: default

    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Service
    metadata:
      name: my-service
    spec:
      type: LoadBalancer
      selector:
        app: MyApp
      ports:
      - protocol: TCP
        port: 80
        targetPort: 9376
  

    module ApiClient
      class Base
        include HTTParty
        base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

        def initialize(token)
          @options = {
            headers: {
              'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
              'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
            }
          }
        end

        def get(endpoint)
          self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
        end

        def post(endpoint, data)
          self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
        end
      end
    end
  
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: web-app
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: web
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: web
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: app
        image: myapp:1.0
        env:
        - name: DATABASE_URL
          value: postgres://db:5432
 
apiVersion: apps/v1kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: web-app
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: web
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: web
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: app
        image: myapp:1.0
        env:
        - name: DATABASE_URL
          value: postgres://db:5432
 

    module ApiClient
      class Base
        include HTTParty
        base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

        def initialize(token)
          @options = {
            headers: {
              'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
              'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
            }
          }
        end

        def get(endpoint)
          self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
        end

        def post(endpoint, data)
          self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
        end
      end
    end

#!/bin/bash

for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
  echo "Processing node: $node"
  oc adm cordon "$node"
  oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
  echo "Node $node drained successfully"
done

echo "All nodes processed"

        - containerPort: 80

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: web-app
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: web
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: web
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: app
        image: myapp:1.0
        env:
        - name: DATABASE_URL
          value: postgres://db:5432
 

    class DataService {
      constructor(apiUrl) {
        this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
        this.cache = new Map();
      }

      async fetchData(id) {
        if (this.cache.has(id)) {
          return this.cache.get(id);
        }

        const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
        const data = await response.json();
        this.cache.set(id, data);
        return data;
      }

      clearCache() {
        this.cache.clear();
      }
    }

    export default DataService;
  

    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Pod
    metadata:
      name: example-pod
      namespace: default
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx:latest
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
  

    apiVersion: apps/v1
    kind: Deployment
    metadata:
      name: web-app
    spec:
      replicas: 3
      selector:
        matchLabels:
          app: web
      template:
        metadata:
          labels:
            app: web
        spec:
          containers:
          - name: app
            image: myapp:1.0
            env:
            - name: DATABASE_URL
              value: postgres://db:5432
  
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: my-service
spec:
  type: LoadBalancer
  selector:
    app: MyApp
  ports:
  - protocol: TCP
    port: 80
    targetPort: 9376
 

    const processArray = (arr) => {
      return arr
        .filter(item => item.active)
        .map(item => ({
          ...item,
          timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
        }))
        .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
    };

    const debounce = (func, wait) => {
      let timeout;
      return function executedFunction(...args) {
        const later = () => {
          clearTimeout(timeout);
          func(...args);
        };
        clearTimeout(timeout);
        timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
      };
    };

 class DataService { constructor(apiUrl) { this.apiUrl = apiUrl; this.cache = new Map(); } async fetchData(id) { if (this.cache.has(id)) { return this.cache.get(id); } const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`); const data = await response.json(); this.cache.set(id, data); return data; } clearCache() { this.cache.clear(); } } export default DataService;

      "roles": ["admin", "user"]

import express from 'express';
import { createServer } from 'http';

const app = express();
const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

app.use(express.json());

app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
  res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
});

app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
  const { data } = req.body;
  // Process data
  res.json({ success: true, data });
});

createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
  console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
});

  "clusters": [{
    "name": "my-cluster",

    }
  }],
  "users": [{
    "name": "admin",
    "user": {
      "token": "sample-token-here"
    }
  }]
}

    class User < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
      has_many :comments

      validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
      validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

      before_save :normalize_email

        self.email = email.downcase.strip

    #!/bin/bash

    set -euo pipefail

    BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
    TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

    echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

    # Create backup directory
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

    # Backup database
    pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Compress backup
    gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
    find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

    echo "Backup completed successfully"
  

    #!/bin/bash

    set -euo pipefail

    BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
    TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

    echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

    # Create backup directory
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

    # Backup database
    pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Compress backup
    gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
    find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

    echo "Backup completed successfully"
  
    class User < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
      has_many :comments

      validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
      validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

      before_save :normalize_email

      def full_name
        "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
      end

      private

      def normalize_email
        self.email = email.downcase.strip
      end
    end
  

    #!/bin/bash

    for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
      echo "Processing node: $node"
      oc adm cordon "$node"
      oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
      echo "Node $node drained successfully"
    done

    echo "All nodes processed"
  
import express from 'express';
import { createServer } from 'http';

const app = express();
const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

app.use(express.json());

app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
  res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
});

app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
  const { data } = req.body;
  // Process data
  res.json({ success: true, data });
});

createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
  console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
});
 
{  "users": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "John Doe",
      "email": "john@example.com",
      "roles": ["admin", "user"]
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Jane Smith",
      "email": "jane@example.com",
      "roles": ["user"]
    }
  ],
  "metadata": {
    "total": 2,
    "page": 1
  }
}
 

    require 'sinatra'
    require 'json'

    set :port, 4567
    set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

    before do
      content_type :json
    end

    get '/api/status' do
      { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
    end

    post '/api/users' do
      data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
      # Process user creation
      { success: true, user: data }.to_json
    end

    error 404 do
      { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
    end
  
{
  "name": "my-package",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A sample package",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "jest",
    "build": "webpack --mode production",
    "start": "node index.js"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "express": "^4.18.0",
    "dotenv": "^16.0.0"
  }
}

worker-node-3                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-1                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-2                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-3                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
 
#!/bin/bash

for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
  echo "Processing node: $node"
  oc adm cordon "$node"
  oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
  echo "Node $node drained successfully"
done

echo "All nodes processed"
 
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: my-service
spec:
  type: LoadBalancer
  selector:
    app: MyApp
  ports:
  - protocol: TCP
    port: 80
    targetPort: 9376
 
module ApiClient
  class Base
    include HTTParty
    base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

    def initialize(token)
      @options = {
        headers: {
          'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
          'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
        }
      }
    end

    def get(endpoint)
      self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
    end

    def post(endpoint, data)
      self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
    end
  end
end
 

    require 'sinatra'
    require 'json'

    set :port, 4567
    set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

    before do
      content_type :json
    end

    get '/api/status' do
      { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
    end

    post '/api/users' do
      data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
      # Process user creation
      { success: true, user: data }.to_json
    end

    error 404 do
      { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
    end
#!/bin/bash for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do echo "Processing node: $node" oc adm cordon "$node" oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data echo "Node $node drained successfully" done echo "All nodes processed"

worker-node-1                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
worker-node-2                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
worker-node-3                  Ready    worker   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-1                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-2                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
control-plane-3                Ready    master   15d   v1.28.2
 

    apiVersion: apps/v1
    kind: Deployment
    metadata:
      name: web-app
    spec:
      replicas: 3
      selector:
        matchLabels:
          app: web
      template:
        metadata:
          labels:
            app: web
        spec:
          containers:
          - name: app
            image: myapp:1.0
            env:
            - name: DATABASE_URL
              value: postgres://db:5432
  
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: example-pod
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - name: nginx
    image: nginx:latest
    ports:
    - containerPort: 80
 Deployment successful! Application version: 2.5.0 Environment: production Replicas: 5 Health check: PASSED Database migration: COMPLETED Cache warmed: YES Deployment time: 2m 34s 

    import express from 'express';
    import { createServer } from 'http';

    const app = express();
    const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

    app.use(express.json());

    app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
      res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
    });

    app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
      const { data } = req.body;
      // Process data
      res.json({ success: true, data });
    });

    createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
      console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
    });
  

    Deployment successful!
    Application version: 2.5.0
    Environment: production
    Replicas: 5
    Health check: PASSED
    Database migration: COMPLETED
    Cache warmed: YES
    Deployment time: 2m 34s
  
#!/bin/bash

# Deploy script for web application

APP_NAME="myapp"
DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

# Pull latest code
cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
git pull origin main

# Install dependencies
npm ci --production

# Build application
npm run build

# Restart service
systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

# Check health
sleep 5
curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

echo "Deployment completed successfully"
 

    Deployment successful!
    Application version: 2.5.0
    Environment: production
    Replicas: 5
    Health check: PASSED
    Database migration: COMPLETED
    Cache warmed: YES
    Deployment time: 2m 34s
  

    #!/bin/bash

    set -euo pipefail

    BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
    TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

    echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

    # Create backup directory
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

    # Backup database
    pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Compress backup
    gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
    find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

    echo "Backup completed successfully"
  
class User < ApplicationRecord  has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :comments

  validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
  validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

  before_save :normalize_email

  def full_name
    "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
  end

  private

  def normalize_email
    self.email = email.downcase.strip
  end
end
 class DataService { constructor(apiUrl) { this.apiUrl = apiUrl; this.cache = new Map(); } async fetchData(id) { if (this.cache.has(id)) { return this.cache.get(id); } const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`); const data = await response.json(); this.cache.set(id, data); return data; } clearCache() { this.cache.clear(); } } export default DataService; 
class DataService {
  constructor(apiUrl) {
    this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
    this.cache = new Map();
  }

  async fetchData(id) {
    if (this.cache.has(id)) {
      return this.cache.get(id);
    }

    const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
    const data = await response.json();
    this.cache.set(id, data);
    return data;
  }

  clearCache() {
    this.cache.clear();
  }
}

export default DataService;
 
class User < ApplicationRecord
  has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :comments

  validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
  validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

  before_save :normalize_email

  def full_name
    "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
  end

  private

  def normalize_email
    self.email = email.downcase.strip
  end
end
 

    module ApiClient
      class Base
        include HTTParty
        base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

        def initialize(token)
          @options = {
            headers: {
              'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
              'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
            }
          }
        end

        def get(endpoint)
          self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
        end

        def post(endpoint, data)
          self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
        end
      end
    end
  

    {
      "users": [
        {
          "id": 1,
          "name": "John Doe",
          "email": "john@example.com",
          "roles": ["admin", "user"]
        },
        {
          "id": 2,
          "name": "Jane Smith",
          "email": "jane@example.com",
          "roles": ["user"]
        }
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "total": 2,
        "page": 1
      }
    }

Error: Connection timeout
Retrying... (attempt 1/3)
Retrying... (attempt 2/3)
Retrying... (attempt 3/3)
Failed to connect to database
Rolling back deployment...
Rollback completed successfully
Previous version restored: 2.4.9
 
const processArray = (arr) => {
  return arr
    .filter(item => item.active)
    .map(item => ({
      ...item,
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
    }))
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
};

const debounce = (func, wait) => {
  let timeout;
  return function executedFunction(...args) {
    const later = () => {
      clearTimeout(timeout);
      func(...args);
    };
    clearTimeout(timeout);
    timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
  };
};
 

    {
      "name": "my-package",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "description": "A sample package",
      "main": "index.js",
      "scripts": {
        "test": "jest",
        "build": "webpack --mode production",
        "start": "node index.js"
      },
      "dependencies": {
        "express": "^4.18.0",
        "dotenv": "^16.0.0"
      }
    }
  

    apiVersion: apps/v1
    kind: Deployment
    metadata:
      name: web-app
    spec:
      replicas: 3
      selector:
        matchLabels:
          app: web
      template:
        metadata:
          labels:
            app: web
        spec:
          containers:
          - name: app
            image: myapp:1.0
            env:
            - name: DATABASE_URL
              value: postgres://db:5432
  
class DataService {
  constructor(apiUrl) {
    this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
    this.cache = new Map();
  }

  async fetchData(id) {
    if (this.cache.has(id)) {
      return this.cache.get(id);
    }

    const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
    const data = await response.json();
    this.cache.set(id, data);
    return data;
  }

  clearCache() {
    this.cache.clear();
  }
}

export default DataService;
 
class User < ApplicationRecord
  has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :comments

  validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
  validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

  before_save :normalize_email

  def full_name
    "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
  end

  private

  def normalize_email
    self.email = email.downcase.strip
  end
end
 
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: example-pod
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - name: nginx
    image: nginx:latest
    ports:
    - containerPort: 80
 

    #!/bin/bash

    set -euo pipefail

    BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
    TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

    echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

    # Create backup directory
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

    # Backup database
    pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Compress backup
    gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
    find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

    echo "Backup completed successfully"
  
const processArray = (arr) => {
  return arr
    .filter(item => item.active)
    .map(item => ({
      ...item,
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
    }))
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
};

const debounce = (func, wait) => {
  let timeout;
  return function executedFunction(...args) {
    const later = () => {
      clearTimeout(timeout);
      func(...args);
    };
    clearTimeout(timeout);
    timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
  };
};
 
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: example-pod
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - name: nginx
    image: nginx:latest
    ports:
    - containerPort: 80
 
module ApiClient
  class Base
    include HTTParty
    base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

    def initialize(token)
      @options = {
        headers: {
          'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
          'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
        }
      }
    end

    def get(endpoint)
      self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
    end

    def post(endpoint, data)
      self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
    end
  end
end
 
#!/bin/bash

# Deploy script for web application

APP_NAME="myapp"
DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

# Pull latest code
cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
git pull origin main

# Install dependencies
npm ci --production

# Build application
npm run build

# Restart service
systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

# Check health
sleep 5
curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

echo "Deployment completed successfully"
 
#!/bin/bash
# Deploy script for web application

APP_NAME="myapp"
DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

# Pull latest code
cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
git pull origin main

# Install dependencies
npm ci --production

# Build application
npm run build

# Restart service
systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

# Check health
sleep 5
curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

echo "Deployment completed successfully"
 

    #!/bin/bash

    # Deploy script for web application

    APP_NAME="myapp"
    DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
    REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

    echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

    # Pull latest code
    cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
    git pull origin main

    # Install dependencies
    npm ci --production

    # Build application
    npm run build

    # Restart service
    systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

    # Check health
    sleep 5
    curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

    echo "Deployment completed successfully"
  
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: example-pod
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - name: nginx
    image: nginx:latest
    ports:
    - containerPort: 80
 
require 'sinatra'
require 'json'

set :port, 4567
set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

before do
  content_type :json
end

get '/api/status' do
  { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
end

post '/api/users' do
  data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
  # Process user creation
  { success: true, user: data }.to_json
end

error 404 do
  { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
end
 
require 'sinatra'
require 'json'

set :port, 4567
set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

before do
  content_type :json
end

get '/api/status' do
  { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
end

post '/api/users' do
  data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
  # Process user creation
  { success: true, user: data }.to_json
end

error 404 do
  { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
end
 

    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Pod
    metadata:
      name: example-pod
      namespace: default
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx:latest
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
  
    class DataService {
      constructor(apiUrl) {
        this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
        this.cache = new Map();
      }

      async fetchData(id) {
        if (this.cache.has(id)) {
          return this.cache.get(id);
        }

        const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
        const data = await response.json();
        this.cache.set(id, data);
        return data;
      }

      clearCache() {
        this.cache.clear();
      }
    }

    export default DataService;
  
import express from 'express';
import { createServer } from 'http';

const app = express();
const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

app.use(express.json());

app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
  res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
});

app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
  const { data } = req.body;
  // Process data
  res.json({ success: true, data });
});

createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
  console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
});
 
module ApiClient
  class Base
    include HTTParty
    base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

    def initialize(token)
      @options = {
        headers: {
          'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
          'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
        }
      }
    end

    def get(endpoint)
      self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
    end

    def post(endpoint, data)
      self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
    end
  end
end
 

    import express from 'express';
    import { createServer } from 'http';

    const app = express();
    const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

    app.use(express.json());

    app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
      res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
    });

    app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
      const { data } = req.body;
      // Process data
      res.json({ success: true, data });
    });

    createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
      console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
    });

      "users": [
        {
          "id": 1,
          "name": "John Doe",
          "email": "john@example.com",
          "roles": ["admin", "user"]
        },

          "id": 2,
          "name": "Jane Smith",
          "email": "jane@example.com",
          "roles": ["user"]
        }
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "total": 2,
        "page": 1
      }
    }

  // Process data
  res.json({ success: true, data });

  console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);

    import express from 'express';
    import { createServer } from 'http';

    const app = express();
    const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

    app.use(express.json());

    app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
      res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
    });

    app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
      const { data } = req.body;
      // Process data
      res.json({ success: true, data });
    });

    createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
      console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);

{
  "users": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "John Doe",
      "email": "john@example.com",
      "roles": ["admin", "user"]
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "name": "Jane Smith",
      "email": "jane@example.com",
      "roles": ["user"]
    }
  ],
  "metadata": {
    "total": 2,
    "page": 1
  }

class DataService {  constructor(apiUrl) {
    this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
    this.cache = new Map();
  }

  async fetchData(id) {
    if (this.cache.has(id)) {
      return this.cache.get(id);
    }

    const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
    const data = await response.json();
    this.cache.set(id, data);
    return data;
  }

  clearCache() {
    this.cache.clear();
  }
}

export default DataService;

      "id": 2,
      "name": "Jane Smith",
      "email": "jane@example.com",

    metadata:
      name: example-pod
      namespace: default
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx:latest
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
  

    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Pod
    metadata:
      name: example-pod
      namespace: default
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx:latest
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
  
    require 'sinatra'
    require 'json'

    set :port, 4567
    set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

    before do
      content_type :json
    end

    get '/api/status' do
      { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
    end

    post '/api/users' do
      data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
      # Process user creation
      { success: true, user: data }.to_json
    end

    error 404 do
      { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
    end
  

    apiVersion: apps/v1
    kind: Deployment
    metadata:
      name: web-app
    spec:
      replicas: 3
      selector:
        matchLabels:
          app: web
      template:
        metadata:
          labels:
            app: web
        spec:
          containers:
          - name: app
            image: myapp:1.0
            env:
            - name: DATABASE_URL
              value: postgres://db:5432
  

    apiVersion: v1
    kind: Service
    metadata:
      name: my-service
    spec:
      type: LoadBalancer
      selector:
        app: MyApp
      ports:
      - protocol: TCP
        port: 80
        targetPort: 9376
  
#!/bin/bash

for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
  echo "Processing node: $node"
  oc adm cordon "$node"
  oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
  echo "Node $node drained successfully"
done

echo "All nodes processed"
 

    {
      "apiVersion": "v1",
      "kind": "Config",
      "clusters": [
        {
          "name": "my-cluster",
          "cluster": {
            "server": "https://api.example.com:6443",
            "certificate-authority": "/path/to/ca.crt"
          }
        }
      ],
      "users": [
        {
          "name": "admin",
          "user": {
            "token": "sample-token-here"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  

    #!/bin/bash

    for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
      echo "Processing node: $node"
      oc adm cordon "$node"
      oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
      echo "Node $node drained successfully"
    done

    echo "All nodes processed"
  

    #!/bin/bash

    # Deploy script for web application

    APP_NAME="myapp"
    DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
    REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

    echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

    # Pull latest code
    cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
    git pull origin main

    # Install dependencies
    npm ci --production

    # Build application
    npm run build

    # Restart service
    systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

    # Check health
    sleep 5
    curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

    echo "Deployment completed successfully"

class DataService { constructor(apiUrl) { this.apiUrl = apiUrl; this.cache = new Map(); } async fetchData(id) { if (this.cache.has(id)) { return this.cache.get(id); } const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`); const data = await response.json(); this.cache.set(id, data); return data; } clearCache() { this.cache.clear(); } } export default DataService;
