    class User < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
      has_many :comments

      validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
      validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

      before_save :normalize_email

      def full_name
        "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
      end

      private

      def normalize_email
        self.email = email.downcase.strip
      end
    end
  
#!/bin/bash

set -euo pipefail

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup database
pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Compress backup
gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed successfully"

    Environment: production
    Replicas: 5
    Health check: PASSED
    Database migration: COMPLETED

    class User < ApplicationRecord
      has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
      has_many :comments

      validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
      validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

      before_save :normalize_email

      def full_name
        "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
      end

      private

      def normalize_email
        self.email = email.downcase.strip
      end
    end

require 'sinatra'
require 'json'

set :port, 4567
set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

before do
  content_type :json
end

get '/api/status' do
  { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
end

post '/api/users' do
  data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
  # Process user creation
  { success: true, user: data }.to_json
end

error 404 do
  { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
end
 
module ApiClient  class Base
    include HTTParty
    base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

    def initialize(token)
      @options = {
        headers: {
          'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
          'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
        }
      }
    end

    def get(endpoint)
      self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
    end

    def post(endpoint, data)
      self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
    end
  end
end
 

    #!/bin/bash

    set -euo pipefail

    BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
    TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

    echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

    # Create backup directory
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

    # Backup database
    pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Compress backup
    gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
    find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

    echo "Backup completed successfully"

    #!/bin/bash

    # Deploy script for web application

    APP_NAME="myapp"
    DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
    REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

    echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

    # Pull latest code
    cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
    git pull origin main

    # Install dependencies
    npm ci --production

    # Build application
    npm run build

    # Restart service
    systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

    # Check health
    sleep 5
    curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

    echo "Deployment completed successfully"
  
require 'sinatra'
require 'json'

set :port, 4567
set :bind, '0.0.0.0'

before do
  content_type :json
end

get '/api/status' do
  { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
end

post '/api/users' do
  data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
  # Process user creation
  { success: true, user: data }.to_json
end

error 404 do
  { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
end

    import express from 'express';
    import { createServer } from 'http';

    const app = express();
    const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

    app.use(express.json());

    app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
      res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
    });

    app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
      const { data } = req.body;
      // Process data
      res.json({ success: true, data });
    });

    createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
      console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
    });
  
class User < ApplicationRecord
  has_many :posts, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :comments

  validates :email, presence: true, uniqueness: true
  validates :username, presence: true, length: { minimum: 3 }

  before_save :normalize_email

  def full_name
    "#{first_name} #{last_name}"
  end

  private

  def normalize_email
    self.email = email.downcase.strip
  end
end
 

    #!/bin/bash

    set -euo pipefail

    BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
    TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

    echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

    # Create backup directory
    mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

    # Backup database
    pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Compress backup
    gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

    # Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
    find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

    echo "Backup completed successfully"
  
    #!/bin/bash

    for node in $(oc get nodes -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}'); do
      echo "Processing node: $node"
      oc adm cordon "$node"
      oc adm drain "$node" --ignore-daemonsets --delete-emptydir-data
      echo "Node $node drained successfully"
    done

    echo "All nodes processed"
  

    class DataService {
      constructor(apiUrl) {
        this.apiUrl = apiUrl;
        this.cache = new Map();
      }

      async fetchData(id) {
        if (this.cache.has(id)) {
          return this.cache.get(id);
        }

        const response = await fetch(`${this.apiUrl}/${id}`);
        const data = await response.json();
        this.cache.set(id, data);
        return data;
      }

      clearCache() {
        this.cache.clear();
      }
    }

    export default DataService;
  

    module ApiClient
      class Base
        include HTTParty
        base_uri ENV['API_BASE_URL']

        def initialize(token)
          @options = {
            headers: {
              'Authorization' => "Bearer #{token}",
              'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
            }
          }
        end

        def get(endpoint)
          self.class.get(endpoint, @options)
        end

        def post(endpoint, data)
          self.class.post(endpoint, @options.merge(body: data.to_json))
        end
      end
    end
  

    {
      "name": "my-package",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "description": "A sample package",
      "main": "index.js",
      "scripts": {
        "test": "jest",
        "build": "webpack --mode production",
        "start": "node index.js"
      },
      "dependencies": {
        "express": "^4.18.0",
        "dotenv": "^16.0.0"
      }
    }
  

    #!/bin/bash

    # Deploy script for web application

    APP_NAME="myapp"
    DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
    REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

    echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

    # Pull latest code
    cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
    git pull origin main

    # Install dependencies
    npm ci --production

    # Build application
    npm run build

    # Restart service
    systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

    # Check health
    sleep 5
    curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

    echo "Deployment completed successfully"
  
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: my-service
spec:
  type: LoadBalancer
  selector:
    app: MyApp
  ports:
  - protocol: TCP
    port: 80
    targetPort: 9376
 
const processArray = (arr) => {
  return arr
    .filter(item => item.active)
    .map(item => ({
      ...item,
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
    }))
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
};

const debounce = (func, wait) => {
  let timeout;
  return function executedFunction(...args) {
    const later = () => {
      clearTimeout(timeout);
      func(...args);
    };
    clearTimeout(timeout);
    timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
  };
};
 
#!/bin/bash

# Deploy script for web application

APP_NAME="myapp"
DEPLOY_DIR="/opt/$APP_NAME"
REPO_URL="https://github.com/user/repo.git"

echo "Deploying $APP_NAME..."

# Pull latest code
cd "$DEPLOY_DIR" || exit 1
git pull origin main

# Install dependencies
npm ci --production

# Build application
npm run build

# Restart service
systemctl restart "$APP_NAME"

# Check health
sleep 5
curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

echo "Deployment completed successfully"
 
import express from 'express';
import { createServer } from 'http';

const app = express();
const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;

app.use(express.json());

app.get('/api/health', (req, res) => {
  res.json({ status: 'healthy', timestamp: Date.now() });
});

app.post('/api/data', async (req, res) => {
  const { data } = req.body;
  // Process data
  res.json({ success: true, data });
});

createServer(app).listen(PORT, () => {
  console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
});
 
{
  "apiVersion": "v1",
  "kind": "Config",
  "clusters": [{
    "name": "my-cluster",
    "cluster": {
      "server": "https://api.example.com:6443",
      "certificate-authority": "/path/to/ca.crt"
    }
  }],
  "users": [{
    "name": "admin",
    "user": {
      "token": "sample-token-here"
    }
  }]
}
 
#!/bin/bash

set -euo pipefail

BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups"
TIMESTAMP=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

echo "Starting backup at $TIMESTAMP"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Backup database
pg_dump mydb > "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Compress backup
gzip "$BACKUP_DIR/db_backup_$TIMESTAMP.sql"

# Remove old backups (keep last 7 days)
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "db_backup_*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Backup completed successfully"

require 'json'

  content_type :json
end

  { status: 'ok', version: '1.0.0' }.to_json
end

post '/api/users' do
  data = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
  # Process user creation
  { success: true, user: data }.to_json
end

error 404 do
  { error: 'Not found' }.to_json
